text.*:
For other uses, see Sin City (disambiguation).

Sin City is an urban area (a city or part of) that caters to various vices. These vices may be legal (depending on area) or illegal activities which are tolerated.

Examples of vices include sex-related services (prostitution, strip clubs, sex shops, etc.), gambling (casinos, betting shops, etc.), or drug use (alcohol, marijuana, etc. consumption), and even excessive organized crime and gang activity. If the city is known for prostitution, it is often called a red-light district, as in Amsterdam, Netherlands.

Sin Cities in the world[edit]

Cities or areas that have this reputation include:

Africa[edit]

  • Morocco
    • Marrakesh (prostitution, gambling, drinking, clubbing)[1]

Asia[edit]

  • Azerbaijan
    • Baku (political corruption, clubbing, drinking, organized crime, bribery, police corruption, prostitution)[2]
  • Bahrain
    • Manama (drinking, clubs, prostitution)[3]
  • China
    • Dongguan (prostitution)[4][5]
    • Macau (gambling, organized crime, clubbing, prostitution, drinking)[6][7][8]
  • Israel
    • Tel Aviv (strip clubs, drinking, clubbing, parties)[9][6]
  • Lebanon
    • Beirut (prostitution, strip clubs, cabarets, drugs, drinking, clubbing).[10][6]
  • Philippines
    • Angeles City (prostitution, gambling, drinking, clubbing)[6][11]
  • Thailand
    • Bangkok (prostitution,[12] strip clubs, sex shows, scams, BDSM, brothels, massage parlors, cabarets, go-go bars, drugs, drinking, clubbing, muay thai boxing)[6]
    • Pattaya (prostitution, strip clubs, sex shows, BDSM, brothels, massage parlors, cabarets, go-go bars, drugs, drinking, clubbing, muay thai boxing)[13][6]

Europe[edit]

  • Cyprus
    • Ayia Napa (drugs, drinking, clubbing)[14][15]
  • Czech Republic
    • Prague (prostitution, organized crime, police corruption, clubbing, strip clubs, brothels)[16][6]
  • The Netherlands
    • Amsterdam (prostitution, brothels, strip clubs, sex shops, sex shows, marijuana consumption)[3][6]
  • Russia
    • Moscow (organized crime, gangs, clubbing, drinking, drugs, police corruption, political corruption, prostitution, strip clubs)[3][6]
  • Spain
    • Ibiza (clubbing,[17] drugs)[6]
  • United Kingdom
    • Liverpool, England[18]
    • Soho, London, England[19][6]

North America[edit]

  • Mexico
    • Tijuana (drugs, prostitution, drinking, police corruption, strip-clubs)[3]
  • United States
    • California
      • Los Angeles[20] and its Hollywood district (bank robberies, porn industry, sex-publishing industries, tabloids, prostitution (Sunset & Vine); also includes police corruption, nightclubs, drugs, drinking, strip clubs, gangs.)[6]
      • San Francisco (organized crime, gangs, drugs, and prostitution)[21]
    • Florida
      • Miami (gangs, organised crime, drug trafficking, prostitution, drinking, political and police corruption, scams, strip clubs)[6]
    • Kentucky
      • Newport is the first city within North America to be coined the title due to its role in prostitution, gambling, gangs, gunplay, racketeering, and many others.[22]
    • Nevada
      • Las Vegas (gambling, bookmaking, easy marriage, easy divorce, organized crime, prostitution [however, prostitution is illegal in Las Vegas and Clark County], strip clubs, cabarets, clubbing, 24-hour liquor sales [as in all of Nevada];[23][6] quote: "What happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas."). In former days it was known also for organized crime and police and political corruption.
      • Reno[24] (gambling, drinking, strip clubs, clubbing, easy marriage, easy divorce, prostitution [however, prostitution is illegal in Reno and Washoe County] 24-hour liquor sales [as in all of Nevada]).
    • New Jersey
      • Atlantic City (gambling, bookmaking, organized crime, drinking, prostitution, clubbling, and strip clubs)[6] (Known as the World Famous Playground) (In the old days it was known also for organized crime, police corruption, and political corruption).[25]
    • New York
      • New York City formerly known for out of control crime, Times Square's sex shops and prostitution and barely hidden drug trade and citywide gangs, including many Mob families and police and political corruption.

South America[edit]

  • Brazil
    • Rio de Janeiro (male & female prostitution, scams, notorious prison system, police corruption, political corruption, drinking, drugs, favelas, gangs, clubbing)[3][6]
  • Colombia
    • Medellin (police corruption, prostitution, drinking, drugs, gangs, clubbing)[26]
  • Venezuela
    • Caracas (scams, prison system corruption, police corruption, political corruption, prostitution, organized crime, drinking, drugs, slums, gangs, robbery, clubbing, drug trafficking, violence)[6]

Oceania[edit]

  • Australia
    • Kings Cross, New South Wales A historically notorious inner-city of Sydney, although this reputation is outdated with the imposition of new lockout laws in February 2014 changing the character of the area dramatically, and arguably eliminating the only "sin city" in Australia.[27] (Prostitution, brothels, gambling (illegal and legal), organized crime, bikie gangs (to an extent), police corruption, drugs, strip clubs, drinking, excessive, drunken and random violence.)[6]
  • New Zealand
    • Auckland[28] [29]

Former Sin Cities[edit]

Asia[edit]

  • China
    • Shanghai 1920s and 1930s.[30] (organized crime, opium dens, gambling, police corruption, political corruption, prostitution)

Europe[edit]

  • Weimar Republic
    • Berlin - 1920s and early 1930s (Prostitution, numerous cabarets, decadence in general)[3]

North America[edit]

  • Canada
    • Montreal, Quebec, which earned a reputation for vice through American tourists fleeing the prohibition laws.[31][32]
  • United States
    • Alabama
      • Phenix City, was notorious during the 1940s and 1950s for being a haven for organized crime, prostitution, and gambling. Many of its customers came from the United States Army training center at Fort Benning, Georgia.[33]
    • Florida
      • Miami,[34] during the 1970s and 1980s (organized crime, drug trafficking, gangs, strip clubs, clubbing, drinking, police corruption, and political corruption)
    • Illinois
      • Chicago in the 1920s to 1930s (prostitution, bootlegging, cabarets, speakeasies, illegal gambling, bank robberies, police corruption, political corruption, organized crime, and gang activity)
    • Indiana
      • Michigan City was considered Sin City in the 1980-1990s, with the proliferation of massage parlors.[35]
      • Terre Haute was labeled Sin City by the monthly magazine Stag in 1955. (reputation for being "wide open", with gambling and a well-developed "red light district").[36] Now the federal death row is in Terre Haute at the Terre Haute Federal Correctional Complex.
    • Kentucky
      • Covington, Kentucky (brothels, gambling, organized crime) [37]
      • Newport, Kentucky (brothels, gambling, organized crime) [37]
    • Louisiana
      • New Orleans[38] from 1897 through 1917, Storyville district (prostitution, brothels, gambling, and speakeasies)
    • New York
      • New York City in the mid to late 19th Century and 20 century (prostitution, brothels, illegal gambling, notorious slums, pickpocketing, police corruption, political corruption, drugs, gangs, organized crime), Times Square from the mid-1960s until circa 1990 (prostitution, pornography, go-go bars, sex shops, sex shows, squeegee men, strip clubs, clubbing, drugs, organized crime)
      • Utica, in the 1930s through the 1950s for the extent of its corruption and control from political machines, presence of organized crime.[39]
    • Texas
      • Galveston in the 1920s to 1957 (prostitution, organized crime, gambling, speakeasies, drinking, police corruption, political corruption)[40]

See also[edit]

  • Grand Theft Auto: Vice City
  • Sodom and Gomorrah
  • Red-light district
  • Sin City (film)
  • Gotham City
